data.question: What is the empirical formula for Co-btca?
At what temperature was the DSC analysis of Co-btca performed?
data.answer: Room temperature to 173 K and back to room temperature

data.question: What was the pressure range explored in the HP SC-XRD study of Co-btca in Daphne Oil?
Is the guest exchange in Co-btca selective?
data.answer: Yes, Co-btca selectively exchanges solvent molecules at ambient conditions.

data.question: What method was used to estimate the guest content in Co-btca∙x MeOH at high pressure?
What was the guest content percentage in Co-btca∙x MeOH at 0.3 GPa according to PLATON/SQUEEZE?
Did the crystal structure of Co-btca∙2 DMF∙H2O change under high pressure?
data.answer: Yes, the crystal structure changed under high pressure.

data.question: What was the main crystallographic direction used to view the crystal packing of Co-btca∙x MeOH?
data.answer: The main crystallographic directions were not specified.

data.question: What was the pressure used to promote the coordination of one MeOH to one of the two unsaturated Co centers in Co-btca?
Is the guest uptake in Co-btca fully reversible?
data.answer: Yes, the guest uptake is fully reversible.

data.question: What was the method used for the ambient pressure P-XRD experiments?
data.answer: The experiments were performed at the X04SA Materials Science Beamline at the Swiss Light Source, using a Mythen II microstrip detector.

data.question: What was the guest molecule exchanged in Co-btca at ambient conditions?
data.answer: MeOH (methanol) was exchanged in Co-btca at ambient conditions.

data.question: Was the guest exchange in Co-btca influenced by the presence of EtOH?
data.answer: Yes, in the absence of MeOH, EtOH can also be absorbed.

data.question: What was the crystal system of Co-btca after decompression from high pressure experiments in ME?
Did the volume of the primitive unit cell of Co-btca∙x MeOH increase or decrease under high pressure?
data.answer: The volume initially increased up to 1 GPa and then decreased.

data.question: Was the guest content in Co-btca∙x MeOH at 2.2 GPa higher or lower than at 0.3 GPa?
Is the coordination reaction of Co-btca with extra-framework ligands temperature-dependent?
data.answer: Yes, the coordination reaction is temperature-dependent.

data.question: What was the guest content percentage in Co-btca∙x MeOH at 2.2 GPa according to PLATON/SQUEEZE?
Was the guest content in Co-btca∙2 DMF∙H2O accurately estimated by PLATON/SQUEEZE?
data.answer: Yes, the estimation was in excellent agreement with the experimentally determined formula.

data.question: What was the main purpose of the HP SC-XRD study of Co-btca in Daphne Oil?
data.answer: To explore the dynamic behavior of Co-btca under high pressure.
